body_html:
I am unconvinced by "user expectations" (If tensorboard is wanted; just install it).

However can you elaborate on

  • PyPi concerns (what are they?)
  • "important factors need to be taken into consideration when distributing TensorFlow" (what are they?)
    You mention static linkage and security, but I can't see how depending on tensorboard improves that. On the contrary, not dependending on tensorboard would reduce the surface area of tensorflow and thus harden its security.

PyPi concerns (what are they?)
"important factors need to be taken into consideration when distributing TensorFlow" (what are they?)
You mention static linkage and security, but I can't see how depending on tensorboard improves that. On the contrary, not dependending on tensorboard would reduce the surface area of tensorflow and thus harden its security.
body:
I am unconvinced by "user expectations" (If tensorboard is wanted; just install it).

However can you elaborate on 
- PyPi concerns (what are they?)
- "important factors need to be taken into consideration when distributing TensorFlow" (what are they?)
You mention static linkage and security, but I can't see how depending on tensorboard improves that. On the contrary, not dependending on tensorboard would reduce the surface area of tensorflow and thus harden its security.
